meanings.definition: To bring to a common center; to concentrate.
meanings.sent1: She was concentering all her energy on finishing her homework.
meanings.sent2: The students were concentering on the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent3: The cat was concentering on catching the elusive red dot.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts concentered on the upcoming exam like a laser beam.
meanings.sent5: The sun concentered its rays on the flower, making it glow.

meanings.sent3: The concentering of attention on the tiny puppy was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: The concentering of ideas in the brainstorming session sparked creativity.
